item.title: Gun-consecration
item.description: My gun, blessed by Manjuśrī and Yamāntaka: Its body is like the body of the lion. Its voice is like the voice of the dragon. Its medicine is like the medicine of Manjushri. Its shot is like the stars of the firmament. Its cock is like the claws of the Garuda-bird.c Its fire is like the lightning of the naga-s. Its ramrod is like the medicine of the doctor Which removes impurities.

item.title: shagdar-wish
item.description: विस्तारः (द्रष्टुं नोद्यम्) A verse by Crazy Shagdar, a wandering Mongol vajrayAnist who went around satirizing high folks. On meeting a lama with a tAntrika partner. I don’t want a blessing to be rich like Vaisravana. I don’t want a blessing to be bold like the tigers and panthers. I want to be like the married lamas. I want a blessing to have a woman around the place, like you.
